Create a single-cell Haircut experiment

Source: R/expt.R
create_sce_haircut.Rd

Create a single-cell Haircut experiment

create_sce_haircut(path, norm_method = "clr_normalize", adducts = NULL)

Arguments

path

path to output matrices.
norm_method

Normalization method for counts. Normalized data is stored in logcounts. Set to NULL to skip normalization.
adducts

data_frame with positions of hairpin adducts. Expects two columns named adduct and pos.

Value

SCEHaircut containing a matrix of counts

Examples

create_sce_haircut(scrunchy_data("haircut/"))
#> Loading haircut matrix files: /home/travis/build/hesselberthlab/scrunchy/inst/extdata/haircut
#> class: SCEHaircut 
#> dim: 425 250 
#> metadata(0):
#> assays(2): counts logcounts
#> rownames(425): Abasic_1 Abasic_10 ... riboG_8 riboG_9
#> rowData names(2): hairpin position
#> colnames(250): TGCGGGTTCAACCATG TGGTTCCTCACTTACT ... CTCGAAACACTTAAGC
#>   TGACAACGTCGCATAT
#> colData names(1): cell_id
#> reducedDimNames(0):
#> spikeNames(0):
